author: James Guttman
title: Sinclair Breaks Ground as First Broadcaster Approved for Drone Operations Over People
text:
In a signifigant broadcast journalism milestone, Sinclair has become the first media company to receive Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) approval to operate drones over people and moving vehicles without requiring special waivers for news gathering purposes.
The authorization, which stems from the FAAâ€™s acceptance of Sinclairâ€™s Declaration of Compliance for Operations Over People, represents a major advancement in drone journalism capabilities. This approval allows Sinclair to use specially modified drones while following strict safety protocols that meet federal requirements.
â€œThis approval represents a significant step forward in our ability to deliver high-quality, innovative journalism,â€ said Scott Livingston, Senior Vice President of News for Sinclair in the news release . â€œBy incorporating expanded drone footage, we enhance our coverage of breaking news, local events, weather, and community storiesâ€”offering our audiences more compelling and dynamic storytelling.â€
Extensive Drone Program & Partnership with Virginia Tech Sinclairâ€™s Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) program has been operational since 2016 and has already accumulated impressive credentials:
Active in 50 newsrooms nationwide Completed over 40,000 logged flights Employs 148 FAA-certified pilots Has trained 540 visual observers Central to Sinclairâ€™s success has been its collaboration with Virginia Techâ€™s Mid-Atlantic Aviation Partnership (MAAP), an FAA-designated UAS test site. All Sinclair drone pilots undergo rigorous training at MAAP to ensure they possess advanced skills in drone operations and safety procedures.
Tombo Jones, director for the Virginia Tech Mid-Atlantic Aviation Partnership, praised the collaboration: â€œWe have worked for years with Sinclair, helping to train their pilots, and I have always been impressed with their professionalism and commitment to safety. We were proud to build on that theme by using our FAA-approved test method to test a modified drone that allows Sinclairâ€™s pilots to meet the FAAâ€™s stringent safety requirements.â€
Safety First Approach Jeff Rose, Sinclairâ€™s UAS Chief Pilot, emphasized that safety remains the companyâ€™s top priority: â€œOur dedication to safety is paramount and this achievement is the result of more than a year of extensive preparation, testing, and collaboration with industry and government partners.â€
Rose noted that Sinclair has conducted community outreach meetings in each market where it operates drones, engaging with first responders, Homeland Security, education officials, local government agencies, and the FAA.
This new capability applies to Sinclairâ€™s entire fleet of drones and trained pilots, positioning the company as an industry leader in integrating cutting-edge technology into broadcast journalism while maintaining compliance with the highest safety standards.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->media and entertainment industry

author: Diario Libre
title: Ministerio de Salud reconoce a 29 instituciones sin fines de lucro - Diario Libre
text:
El Ministerio de Salud PÃºblica distinguiÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles a 29 Asociaciones sin Fines de Lucro (ASFL) por su destacado desempeÃ±o en la ejecuciÃ³n de proyectos durante el aÃ±o 2024.
Estas entidades , adscritas al Ministerio de Salud , obtuvieron puntuaciones superiores a los 95 puntos en el proceso de evaluaciÃ³n institucional , que garantiza el uso eficiente y transparente de los fondos pÃºblicos asignados para fortalecer la salud y el bienestar de la poblaciÃ³n.
El acto fue encabezado por el ministro de Salud , VÃ­ctor Atallah , quien valorÃ³ el impacto del trabajo que realizan estas organizaciones en sus comunidades.
"Ustedes tienen la capacidad de llegar a lugares donde, en ocasiones, el Estado no alcanza con la misma efectividad. Y lo hacen con amor, entrega y compromiso , lo cual tiene un valor incalculable ", dijo el titular de salud a travÃ©s de una nota de prensa.
Atallah subrayÃ³ que el respaldo a las entidades que actÃºan con responsabilidad es parte esencial de la misiÃ³n del Estado .
"Ustedes no solo hacen el bien, sino que lo hacen muy bien, y eso tiene un valor especial, son un canal efectivo, con presencia, conocimiento del territorio y vÃ­nculos reales con sus comunidades. El aporte que se les otorga representa una parte importante del presupuesto del Ministerio, y tambiÃ©n una de las formas mÃ¡s nobles de llevar soluciones reales a quienes mÃ¡s lo necesitan", afirmÃ³.
Mientras, la directora de PlanificaciÃ³n y Desarrollo , Rosanna Arias, enfatizÃ³ que el Estado tiene el deber de garantizar el uso justo, equitativo y transparente de los recursos pÃºblicos .
"Este reconocimiento refleja el compromiso de cada una de las ASFL aquÃ­ presentes, por ejecutar de manera eficaz los proyectos aprobados. Alcanzar mÃ¡s de 95 puntos en la evaluaciÃ³n demuestra que estÃ¡n haciendo un uso correcto y responsable de los fondos pÃºblicos", seÃ±alÃ³.

author: Hon Hai Technology Group (Foxconn)
title: Hon Hai Technology Group (Foxconn) und TECO verkÃ¼nden strategische Allianz zur Errichtung von KI-Rechenzentren
text:
Neue AktienbÃ¶rse gibt wichtigen MÃ¤rkten Auftrieb
TAIPEI , 31. Juli 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Die Hon Hai Technology Group (â€žFoxconn") (TWSE:2317) und TECO Electric & Machinery Co Ltd (â€žTECO") gaben am Mittwoch einen Aktientausch und eine strategische Allianz bekannt, die ihre KI-InfrastrukturkapazitÃ¤ten stÃ¤rken und die beiden taiwanesischen Technologiekonzerne in SchlÃ¼sselmÃ¤rkte des globalen Super-Computing-Wettlaufs bringen wird.
Mit diesem Schritt werden die StÃ¤rken von Foxconn, dem weltweit grÃ¶ÃŸten Anbieter von Dienstleistungen im Bereich der Elektronikfertigung und Hersteller von KI-Servern, und TECO, einem fÃ¼hrenden Unternehmen im Bereich der industriellen elektromechanischen Technik und der Innovation im Bereich der grÃ¼nen Energie, zusammengefÃ¼hrt. Die beiden Unternehmen nutzen die Entwicklung des Aufbaus globaler KI-Rechenzentren (AI Data Center, AIDC) in Richtung Standardisierung und Modularisierung und werden gemeinsam GeschÃ¤ftsmÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r AIDCs erkunden. Globale Kunden werden in der Lage sein, umfassende modulare Produkte fÃ¼r Rechenzentren, elektromechanische Ingenieurdienstleistungen und wettbewerbsfÃ¤hige LÃ¶sungen aus einer Hand zu nutzen.
GemÃ¤ÃŸ den von beiden AufsichtsrÃ¤ten genehmigten Bedingungen wird TECO einen Anteil von 0,519 % an Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd. Ã¼bernehmen, dem offiziellen Namen, unter dem Foxconn an der taiwanesischen BÃ¶rse gehandelt wird. Im Gegenzug wird Foxconn 10 % an TECO halten. Foxconn wird 237.644.068 neue Aktien an Foxconn ausgeben, und Foxconn wird 72.481.441 neue Aktien an TECO ausgeben, was einem UmtauschverhÃ¤ltnis von ca. 1 zu 0,305 entspricht. Die bargeldlose Transaktion soll im vierten Quartal dieses Jahres abgeschlossen werden, vorbehaltlich der Zustimmung der AufsichtsbehÃ¶rden.
Der Foxconn-Vorsitzende Young Liu sagte: â€žTime-to-Market ist der SchlÃ¼ssel im weltweiten Wettlauf um Supercomputer. Die modulare Bauweise wird immer beliebter. Da die KI-Rechenzentren immer grÃ¶ÃŸer werden und die Nachfrage steigt, bedeutet die Zusammenarbeit mit TECO, dass beide Unternehmen in der Lage sind, umfassende, vertikal integrierte LÃ¶sungen fÃ¼r unsere Kunden â€“ die Tier-1-CSPs und Hyperscaler â€“ zu liefern.
TECO Chairman Morris Li sagte: â€žDie sich verÃ¤ndernde globale Dynamik schafft neue MÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r GeschÃ¤fte und Zusammenarbeit. Die strategische Partnerschaft erweitert die Zusammenarbeit der beiden Unternehmen in den Bereichen kohlenstoffarme intelligente Fabriken und Energiedienstleistungen, um in Zukunft eine KomplettlÃ¶sung fÃ¼r Rechenzentren anbieten zu kÃ¶nnen."
ZielmÃ¤rkte sind Taiwan , Asien, der Nahe Osten und die USA . Das in Texas ansÃ¤ssige Unternehmen TECO-Westinghouse, ein weltweit fÃ¼hrender Hersteller von Elektromotoren, mit seiner US-Fertigung und seinen lokalen Dienstleistungen sowie die US-Fertigungsbasis von Foxconn entsprechen dem strategischen Ziel der Unternehmen, die US-Fertigung auszubauen und die globale Lieferkette neu zu gestalten.

title: L' IA ha giÃ  imparato a uccidere
text:
L' IA ha giÃ  imparato a uccidere
Davvero rischiamo il futuro immaginato da George Lucas, dove i cloni combattono per una Repubblica che ha giÃƒ perso la sua anima? Oggi non abbiamo cloni. Basta un drone, un algoritmo o un tecnico con la morale in pausa. La galassia lontana ÃƒÂ¨ qui: silenziosa, operativa e invisibile. L'intelligenza artificiale ha giÃƒ imparato a uccidere. Non per odio o per scelta. Lo fa perchÃƒÂ© puÃƒÂ². In Ucraina, l'80% delle perdite russe ÃƒÂ¨ causato da droni. Alcuni costano meno di uno smartphone, altri sono piÃƒÂ¹ intelligenti di chi li lancia, si muovono a 300 all'ora, schivano i radar, si coordinano in sciami e non si stancano mai.

author: Emeline Peltier
title: Shield AI Raises Additional $300M in Series F Funding, Valuation Reaches $2.8B | Robots.net
text: Defense technology startup Shield AI has expanded its Series F funding round by securing an additional $300 million in equity and debt, bringing the total funding to $500 million. The companyâ€™s valuation has now reached $2.8 billion, up from $2.7 billion in November. Key Takeaway Shield AI has raised an additional $300 million in equity and debt, bringing its Series F funding to $500 million and increasing its valuation to $2.8 billion. The company is pioneering AI technology to create autonomous systems for aircraft, with a focus on advancing military deterrence capabilities. Expanding Series F Funding Shield AI closed $200 million in equity in November, and has now raised an additional $100 million in new equity at the Series F price, along with $200 million in debt provided by Hercules Capital. The company has not disclosed the source of the additional equity. Advancements in AI Technology Shield AI is focused on developing an â€œAI pilotâ€ that can transform aircraft into autonomous systems. The flagship product, Hivemind, enables teams of aircraft to operate independently without the need for remote operators, communications, or GPS. CEO Ryan Tseng attributes this capability to recent advances in compute power.

author: Op 442224
title: Miraflores: "cruce del terror" sigue siendo un peligro pese a rompemuelle instalado
text:
En la intersecciÃ³n de las avenidas 28 de Julio y Alcanfores, en el distrito de Miraflores, reina el caos. La zona, conocida ya por vecinos y conductores como â€œel cruce del terrorâ€, ha sido escenario de constantes accidentes, especialmente entre motociclistas y peatones.
La situaciÃ³n ha empeorado a tal punto que, pese a la seÃ±alizaciÃ³n y la reciente colocaciÃ³n de un rompemuelle portÃ¡til, los vehÃ­culos siguen sin reducir la velocidad. â€œEse rompemuelle es muy bajo, no obliga a frenarâ€, comentÃ³ un vecino.
INSTALARÃN ROMPEMUELLE MÃS ALTO
El subgerente de Movilidad Urbana de Miraflores, Renzo Vallejo, asegurÃ³ que se instalarÃ¡ un rompemuelle mÃ¡s alto y permanente en los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as, como parte de las medidas para mitigar los accidentes. No obstante, descartÃ³ la colocaciÃ³n de un semÃ¡foro.
A pesar de que las normas indican que en jirones y calles la velocidad no debe exceder los 30 km/h (y 50 km/h en avenidas), la prÃ¡ctica estÃ¡ lejos de la regla. En este cruce, lo que predomina es el desorden, la imprudencia y la urgencia por llegar primero, a cualquier costo.

author: DENG MACHOL
title: 38 people killed and 52 wounded in communal clashes over land in South Sudan, officials report
text:
38 people killed and 52 wounded in communal clashes over land in South Sudan, officials report
Residents of a swampy area in central South Sudan battled with cattle herders who moved in looking for water and pasture during the dry season, and at least 38 people were killed and 52 suffered gunshot wounds, officials said Thursday.
The fighting started Wednesday and tensions remained high Thursday night, with officials reporting â€œminor clashesâ€ and apprehension over revenge attacks in the remote area.
The information minister of Warrap state, William Wol Mayom, said fighting took place in the Alor area, which is in Lakes state and borders both Warrap and Unity states.
Mayom said security forces had been sent to calm the situation and to move the cattle herders away from the disputed wet lands.
â€œThe violence has been de-escalated, but minor clashes are still being reported in inaccessible swampy areas and casualties cannot be fully verified,â€ Mayom said.
A police spokesperson for Lakes state, Maj. Elijah Mabor Makuach, said 19 of the dead and 17 of the wounded were civilians from Warrap state and 19 of the dead and 35 wounded were from Lakes state.
Makuach said young herders from Warrap migrated to the Alor area with their cattle two weeks ago and began burning brush and the temporary shelters of residents. He said the herders were looking for pasture and water in the swampy lands of Alor.
The bloodshed came four days after at least 52 people, including a U.N. peacekeeper, were killed and 64 wounded by gunmen who attacked villagers in Abyei, an oil-rich region that is claimed by both Sudan and South Sudan. Officials said that violence also arose from a dispute over land.
South Sudan won its independence from Sudan in 2011 after more than 39 years of war and then plunged into a ruinous internal conflict from 2013 to 2018 that stagnated development. Many guns remain in the hands of civilians who fought in the conflicts.

author: Anonym
title: Turkey: a man, claiming to act â€œfor Gazaâ€, holds seven employees of a factory of an American group hostage - The Limited Times
text:
Tension was at its height this Thursday afternoon near the Turkish factory of the American group Procter & Gamble (P&G), located on the outskirts of Istanbul.
An armed man claiming to act â€œfor Gazaâ€ held several employees hostage this Thursday evening.
The hostage taking occurred in the middle of the afternoon, around 3 p.m. local time (12 p.m. GMT), according to Turkish media, in this factory of the American manufacturer of household and hygiene products.
The man, who retains seven employees according to the Umut-Sen union, justified his action by ongoing Israeli military operations in the Gaza Strip, local police said.
Special forces entered into negotiations with him, according to local media.
A Procter & Gamble spokesperson confirmed that its factory in Gebze, on the eastern outskirts of Istanbul, was "evacuated earlier today."
â€œWe are working with local authorities to resolve an urgent security situation,â€ he said.
â€œWorkers were evacuated from the factory;
seven workers remain hostages.
The boss is responsible for their safety,â€ said the Umut-Sen union in a message posted on the social network X.
â€œFor Gazaâ€ painted in red on a wall
A police cordon prevented access to the surroundings of the factory this Thursday evening, where some 500 people are usually employed, AFP journalists noted.
And a riot police bus arrived near the factory.
Images reported by Turkish media, which could not be authenticated, showed a man with his face partially covered by a Palestinian keffiyeh, wearing what could be an explosive belt around his waist and a pistol in his right hand.
â€œFor Gaza,â€ says a message painted in red on a wall behind him, under two Turkish and Palestinian flags facing each other.
Also read â€œOur caregivers fear for their livesâ€: in Gaza, these mobile teams still on the ground
The husband of one of the detained employees told the private news agency DHA that the man had threatened to â€œshoot in all directionsâ€ in the event of police intervention.
â€œIf he does this for Palestine, let him go and fight there.
What does my 26 year old daughter have to do with this?
Â», Reacted Ã‡igdem Aydemir, the mother of one of the detained employees, among anxious relatives waiting in the night.
â€œWe have no information from the inside.
We have been waiting for six hours but no one in charge has made a statement,â€ lamented the father of another hostage, refusing to give his identity.
A boycott of American products in TÃ¼rkiye
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, one of Israel's most critical leaders since the start of the war between the Jewish state and the Palestinian Islamist movement Hamas, has repeatedly denounced US support for Israel, which he described as a â€œterroristâ€ and â€œgenocidalâ€ state.
Calls to boycott American products have also been widely reported in Turkey since the start of the conflict.
Several McDonald's restaurants and Starbucks cafes - which operate under Turkish license - were vandalized across the country.
VIDEO.
Israel-Hamas war: Starbucks, target of pro-Palestinian demonstrators in TÃ¼rkiye
At the beginning of November, Turkish police had to disperse using tear gas a pro-Palestinian rally organized in front of a military base housing American forces, a few hours before a visit to Ankara by Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
Crowds of protesters also gathered in the early days of the conflict in front of the US embassy in Ankara and its consulate in Istanbul.
Demonstrations in support of the Palestinians are regularly organized in the country.

author: Manolo RodrÃ­guez
title: El empleo de las empresas estatales en Galicia repunta gracias a Correos y Navantia - La OpiniÃ³n de A CoruÃ±a
text:
Cuando el Estado entre en el accionariado de TelefÃ³nica â€”ha anunciado que comprarÃ¡ el 10% de la compaÃ±Ã­aâ€”, la Sociedad Estatal de Participaciones Industriales (SEPI) tendrÃ¡ participaciÃ³n en 26 empresas: 14 en las que es accionista principal y 12 en la que es minoritaria. A esta cifra hay que sumarle su presencia indirecta en mÃ¡s de 100 sociedades, ademÃ¡s de las que se acogieron al Fondo de apoyo a la solvencia de empresas estratÃ©gicas creado en 2020 por el Ejecutivo central. Su objetivo es â€œaportar apoyo pÃºblico temporal para reforzar la solvencia de firmas no financieras afectadas por la pandemia del COVID-19 que sean consideradas estratÃ©gicas para el tejido productivo nacional o regionalâ€. Entre las que han recibido las ayudas estatales estÃ¡n el grupo metalÃºrgico FerroatlÃ¡ntica, con una planta en SabÃ³n, que, en febrero del aÃ±o pasado, recibiÃ³ 34,5 millones; la siderÃºrgica Celsa, que tiene una fÃ¡brica en A Laracha, que percibiÃ³ 550 o la ingenierÃ­a Imasa, que tiene una delegaciÃ³n en A CoruÃ±a, y que logrÃ³ 35.
EvoluciÃ³n del nÃºmero de empleados de la SEPI en la Galicia en la Ãºltima dÃ©cada. L. O.
Con TelefÃ³nica, que cuenta de momento con 650 trabajadores en Galicia, aunque, segÃºn los sindicatos, el ERE que ha presentado la multinacional afectarÃ¡ a la mitad de ellos, el empleo vinculado a sociedades participadas por el Estado registrarÃ¡ un repunte en la comunidad. Algo que ya ocurriÃ³ el aÃ±o pasado. En la Ãºltima dÃ©cada, la cifra de empleos de la SEPI en Galicia no habÃ­a dejado de caer. En 2012, rozaban los 7.000 (6.991) y en 2021 habÃ­an descendido hasta los 5.798. Un 10% menos, segÃºn las memorias anuales del holding pÃºblico. Sin embargo, durante el pasado ejercicio se produjo un repunte hasta los 6.281 trabajadores, gracias al aumento de personal, sobre todo, en Correos y Navantia.
En el marco del Acuerdo Plurianual firmado en la primera de estas compaÃ±Ã­as, el aÃ±o pasado se puso en marcha un programa de jubilaciÃ³n parcial para el personal laboral vinculado a contratos de relevo. Pese a ello, Correos ha reforzado su plantilla en la comunidad, pero las organizaciones sindicales denuncian el deterioro de la calidad del empleo.
En Navantia, durante el pasado ejercicio se continuÃ³ con la renovaciÃ³n de la plantilla, contemplada dentro de su Plan EstratÃ©gico 2018-2022. En toda EspaÃ±a, la empresa lanzÃ³ convocatorias para 1.658 personas, de las que 741 correspondieron a Ferrol; 506 a BahÃ­a de CÃ¡diz; 345 a Cartagena y 66 para su sede corporativa en Madrid. En abril, el astillero ferrolano iniciÃ³ la construcciÃ³n de la primera fragata F-110, con el acto de corte de chapa, con lo que tambiÃ©n aumentÃ³ el nÃºmero de trabajadores.
Otras firmas participadas por la SEPI que tienen presencia en Galicia son Tragsa; la agencia de noticias Efe â€”que tiene una delegaciÃ³n en Santiagoâ€” o la Sociedad AnÃ³nima Estatal de CauciÃ³n Agraria (Saeca), que continuÃ³ en 2022 con la gestiÃ³n del Instrumento Financiero de GarantÃ­a Centralizada.
La plantilla del Grupo SEPI a 31 de diciembre de 2022 se situÃ³ en 79.507 personas en toda EspaÃ±a. El mayor volumen se concentra en Correos, con el 63,2%; Tragsa, con el 25,8%; Navantia, con el 5,7%, y la Agencia Efe, con el 1,4%.
Galicia es la cuarta comunidad que mÃ¡s empleados tiene del grupo pÃºblico con el 7,9% del total. Solo la superan Madrid (21,2%), AndalucÃ­a (13,9%) y CataluÃ±a (11,3%), segÃºn la Ãºltima memoria anual del holding. El aÃ±o pasado invirtiÃ³ 213 millones a nivel nacional. El 14,5% (30,8 millones) fue en Galicia, sobre todo, por el arranque de la construcciÃ³n de la F-110 en Ferrol. Solo Madrid (24,3%) y AndalucÃ­a (16,7%) lograron unos porcentajes mayores.
AdemÃ¡s de la presencia en empresas con actividad en Galicia, la SEPI es titular, segÃºn apunta en su informe anual, de una parcela denominada Pedra da Regacha entre los municipios de A CoruÃ±a y Arteixo, que procede de la privatizaciÃ³n de la extinta Inespal Metal, S.A. (antes Alcoa), y que se utilizaba como vertedero de residuos industriales procedentes de la fabricaciÃ³n de aluminio. EstÃ¡ clausurado desde julio de 2001 y tiene una extensiÃ³n de 27.000 metros cuadrados. El aÃ±o pasado enviÃ³ al gestor de residuos peligrosos 150 toneladas de lixiviados producidos en este vertedero. TambiÃ©n cuenta con otro similar en Huesca. El gasto del mantenimiento de ambos en 2022 fue de 48.000 de euros.

author: Himanshu Singh
title: Friday papers: British Steel puts 2,700 jobs at risk at Scunthorpe steelworks
text:
